file_content.text: [The tormentor device is deactivated.]
I thought he'd never leave. You're free. Let's get going.
Not to sound ungrateful, but it's about time!
You're free. Are you alright?
I'd kiss you if we weren't in the middle of Sith central.
I am now. I knew you'd come back.
This place is crawling with Sith who don't know you're back to normal, but you won't fool them forever. We need to leave--quick.
Teeseven and the others are still in the docking bay, locked in cages. We can free everyone and take back the ship.
We have to warn the Jedi Council about what's happened.
Then, we fly home.
One thing at a time. First, let's get out of here alive.
How many Sith are in the docking bay?
What about the guards?
A dozen, give or take. Never said this was gonna be easy.
We aren't leaving until I kill every Sith on the station--especially the Emperor.
I'm destroying this place.
Are you crazy? We barely survived the last fight. We need to get out of here.
Let's begin. It's a simple device. Three inducement settings, each inflicting greater pain on the subject.
The tormentor monitors the subject's vital signs, stopping just short of delivering lethal damage. Still quite agonizing, however.
I know you're still in there. You're not one of them. If I beat him, you can too.
Proceed with the lowest inducement setting. Get your subject focused.
I'm sorry, overseer. There appears to be a problem with the controls.
[Lie] I can't make it work.
Blasted technicians... step aside. I'll have a look.
Well, it's about time. Get me out of this thing.
The tormentor isn't functioning, overseer. It needs repair.
[Force Persuade] It's broken.
The tormentor isn't functioning. It needs repair.
Stay here while I sort this out. If the containment field fails, the subject may attempt to escape.
Bad news, overseer. I don't work for the Emperor anymore--and neither do you.
Focus on this. [Kill him]
